title: Government Agreement visa (subclass 406)
summary: This page provides information for existing holders of the Government Agreement visa (subclass 406), which closed to new applications in 2012. It explains what the visa allows, obligations for visa holders and their families, and what changes must be reported to the government.

visa_details.applicant_availability: only available to existing visa holders

purpose_and_entitlements.description: Visa for people entering Australia under bilateral agreements to direct operations of specific cultural organisations.
allowed_activities: Do the work or activity specified in the relevant government agreement
Direct operations of a listed organisation (if applicable)
Enter and leave Australia multiple times while the visa is valid

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Continue to meet requirements of the granted visa
Meet Australian taxation obligations if working in Australia
work_conditions: Do not stop performing the listed work or activity
Do not work in a position or activity inconsistent with the visa purpose
Only work for the employer listed in the application
family_member_obligations: Remain part of the visa holder's family unit
Enter Australia at the same time or after the visa holder
Leave Australia at the same time or before the visa holder

change_notification_requirements.additional_information: Visa holders must notify the Department of any of the above changes. Guidance is available on how to report these changes.
